beer.beer_description:
The beer is traditionally brewed using only the finest quality of water, barley and rye malts, whole hops and the brewery's own top-fermenting yeast. The colour is deep amber with a red hue derived from the Head Brewer's unique composition of ingredients. The taste is deliciously fruity and malty with a lingering bitter aftertaste. 
This fine beer is brewed to celebrate the approval in November 2003 for the reintroduction of the Great Bustard bird onto the Salisbury Plain.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 360 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 73!

items.checkin_comment: Dal yn dda gyda blas dwfn a diddorol.

items.badge_description: Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 10 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 3.

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 10 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.badge_description: Whether youre feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 65 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 14!

items.badge_description: Awesome!!! You've earned a Barking Cat Badge! You're part of the Clowder of Barking Cats and on the journey to earning FREE BEER ;) Badges 25, 50 & 75 = Free Pint!! Badge 100 = something special :)

items.checkin_comment: Fruity upfront with a caramelly bitterness on the finish.

beer.beer_description:
The beer is traditionally brewed using only the finest quality of water, barley and rye malts, whole hops and the brewery's own top-fermenting yeast. items.checkin_comment: Mild fruity earthy tea leaf, tobacco leaf, nice toasted, bready, caramel, biscuity malt, faint toffee, toast bread aroma, with an earthy light leafy, herbal, floral hop nose, and a earthy rye, toasted, bready, caramel malty, earthy leafy hop bitter taste

user.bio: [Bire, beer, l]   I am a beer trotter! Love beers from around the world. Making my own beer, kombucha and sake too!
